intro: Vernonia hatschbachii, commonly known as the desert ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Vernonia hatschbachii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for native pollinators.
